In this video, I talk about affiliate marketing for beginners 2019. The affiliate marketing strategy I am discussing will guarantee you success in 2019. 

Affiliate marketing tutorial step by step for $100 a day Strategy.

So what is affiliate marketing? You don't need money to market your business. Through affiliate marketing, you can generate sales without having to spend money upfront.

Affiliate marketing is performance based marketing. In which you pay people out every time they drive you a lead or a sale.

The cool part about affiliate marketing is that you decide what you want to pay people every time someone drives you a sale.

Affiliates get sales through SEO, PPC, email marketing or any other channel they please.

The hardest part about selling on affiliate platforms is recruiting affiliates. For this reason, you want to join networks like Clickbank, which will guide you on what you should pay out affiliates and they will help recruit them.

You can also go to conferences like Affiliate Summit or Affiliate World to recruit more affiliates. Plus you will learn about affiliate marketing from these events including how to recruit affiliate marketers.

Now once you get affiliates you want to make sure your landing page converts well. Affiliates are really good at knowing how to market Clickbank products. But if you don't convert your leads into sales, then affiliate marketers will stop promoting your products.

Using Qualaroo you can run surveys on your landing page to figure out what's wrong. In addition to that, you can run tests through Crazy Egg to also help boost your conversion rate.

If you aren't using affiliate marketing, you should consider trying it out. It is one of the most cash efficient marketing channels out there.

Thanks for watching "4 Undeniable Ways to Recruit Affiliate Marketers on Clickbank - Best Clickbank Guide".

Learning how to start affiliate marketing for beginners can seem daunting, but this video shows you exactly why it doesn't have to be!

In fact, learning the affiliate marketing basics, is actually pretty easy. Mastering them and making a full time income can be a bit more of a challenge, but in this video I walk you through the exact steps you should follow to start affiliate marketing, and specifically make your first dollar online.

► Subscribe to My Channel Here - http://bit.ly/1NkDisM

https://www.locationrebel.com/how-to-start-affiliate-marketing/

Best Affiliate Products to Promote: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XKzH51y7PL0

Here's exactly what we cover in the video, along with timestamps to help you find specific aspects of affiliate marketing that you might be trying to learn:

2:47 - How I was living in a warzone in Asia when I started affiliate marketing. 

3:52 - My First Affiliate Promotion (How I Made $500 in 5 Minutes)

4:55  - What is Affiliate Marketing?
 
6:30 - Step #1: Choose a Platform

The only real requirement you need to start affiliate marketing is a platform with which to do it. This could be a blog, niche site, youtube channel etc.

7:44 - Step #2: Choose a Niche

The more you can niche down, the easier it will be to find and grow your audience.

Here's another video that focuses in on that:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CCkIcEwkyWU

9:06 - Step #3: Sign up for the Amazon Affiliate Program 

Amazon has the world's largest affiliate program, and you can sign up for free.

Do that here:
https://affiliate-program.amazon.com/

9:34 - How to Make Your Very First Dollar Online

This is exactly how to make your very first dollar online. It's much easier than you think :)

Here's another video with a similar strategy to make your first $100 online: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4nOlui5Qrdw

9:52 - The Pros and Cons of Amazon’s Affiliate Program

The Amazon affiliate program is great for a lot of things, but there are a lot of drawbacks as well.

11:40 - Step #4: Go Back and Update Old Content

Once you have your affiliate links, go back and update your old content with your new affiliate links.

12:37 - Step #5: The Two Best Type of Content to Create for Affiliate Promotions

There are two types of content I think you should focus on when you're beginning to start affiliate marketing on your blog or niche site. The first is what I call "best" posts.

15:04 - The Second Best Type of Content

The second type of content I recommend is a "review" post.

17:11 - Step #6: Optimize Content

Optimize your content for search. I use SEMrush and LOVE it.

Here's the tool: https://bit.ly/2sKuVVV

Here's my review of it: https://www.locationrebel.com/semrush-review/

17:58 - Step #7: Sign up For Additional Affiliate Programs

Chances are there are places where you can get higher commissions than you would on Amazon. See if you can find some.

19:15 - Step #8: Track Your Results

Again, I use SEMrush for this to make sure I'm updating my content and optimizing to give myself the best chance at succeeding.

https://bit.ly/2sKuVVV

20:18 - Wrapping Up

In this Affiliate Marketing Bangla Tutorial I will share with you What is Affiliate Marketing? How It Works and the Best Networks in the world. 

Affiliate Marketing is a process of selling some others company or people products. Affiliate marketing involves having your own site and sending your traffic to someone else's site to buy their products or services. For every sale initiated by a link from your site, you earn a percentage.

There are 4 parties connected with affiliate marketing. Merchants or advertiser, Networks, Publishers, and Customers.

Merchants have many products they came to networks to promote their products.

Networks is a media that connect merchants and publisher. On networks, publishers apply to promote merchants products. If merchants approve publishers applications they provide unique links, banner. Most popular Affiliate Networks are Clickbank, Amazon associate, Sharesales, CJ, Market health.

Publishers promote the product through Search Engine Optimization, Social Media Marketing, link building among the customers. Customers get information from publishers about the products. and refer to sale by publishers. 

Finally, when customers buy a product fro merchants the track the information and they provide a commission to the refer.

Affiliate marketing is the process of earning a commission by promoting someone else’s product or service.

Affiliate marketing is great, because you don’t have to create or sell a product or a service.  You are simply sharing it with people you know, like family, friends, your followers, subscribers, etc.

I have been able to earn millions of dollars, just by promoting other people’s products, and its always a win-win for everyone involved.  

Why not share a product or service with others, that has helped you in your life, and earn a commission doing so?

#lamgiau #banhang #banhangonline
Video nằm trong chuỗi hỗ trợ Làm Giàu từ Bán Hàng Online.

Tiếp thị liên kết hay còn gọi là Affiliate Marketing, là một trong số những hình thức phổ biến kiếm tiền online đang nổi lên tại Việt Nam. Hình thức này bạn cũng có thể áp dụng trong công việc kinh doanh của mình giúp gia tăng những lợi nhuận từ việc bán khóa học. Đặc điểm của loại hình kinh doanh này là
Bỏ vốn ít hoặc thậm chí có thể không cần vốn cũng có thể kinh doanh được.
Đăng ký dễ dàng.
Thưởng nhận hoa hồng rất cao.
Đã có rất nhiều người tại Việt Nam đang làm tiếp thị liên kết theo kiểu quăng những link tiếp thị liên kết tràn lan trên mạng internet hoặc có thể đầu tư viết một bài sau đó chạy chương trình quảng cáo kèm theo link affiliate. Kết quả là những người tiếp cận khá đông và lượt nhấp vào liên kết cũng không phải là ít nhưng lượng người đăng ký tham gia khóa học thì lại rất hạn chế, thậm chí không có người đăng ký.
Để mà nói thì hầu hết những người làm tiếp thị liên kết tại Việt Nam có xu hướng spam liên kết một cách tràn lan, rất nhiều người bán khóa học mà trong khi họ chưa biết gì về hóa học đó cũng như chưa từng học qua. Đó là sự không trung thực của một người kinh doanh, họ dùng những lời lẽ cũng như là câu từ tưởng tượng ra nhằm bán hàng cho người khác. Đây là mấu chốt của vấn đề, rất nhiều người tiếp thị liên kết mà không ra được đơn hàng do lòng tin của khách hàng là không có.
Vậy làm sao để kinh doanh tiếp thị liên kết được tốt hơn ?
Điều duy nhất web5ngay muốn bạn thực hiện khi làm tiếp thị liên kết các khóa học là “bạn cần phải hiểu bạn đang kinh doanh cái gì?”, “Bạn phải trung thực với khán giả của mình”. Chẳng hạn nếu bạn muốn làm tiếp thị liên kết cho một khóa học dạy về Yoga, bạn cần phải học khóa học trước, và cảm nhận khóa học đó hiệu quả như thế nào rồi hãy giới thiệu tiếp thị liên kết cho người khác: như bạn có thể trồng cây chuối khi học Yoga thì bạn hãy post những hình ảnh trồng cây chuối hay những video bạn thực hiện được khi học và điều này khán giả sẽ có lòng tin hơn là bạn lấy một tấm hình khác trên mạng hay là chỉ post một dòng status nói rằng đăng ký khóa học này bổ ích lắm, sẽ có rất nhiều người không bao giờ tin một chút nào bạn đang nói ra. Điều này cũng giống như việc bạn chưa đi du lịch Sapa bao giờ và bạn đi miêu tả về cảnh ở Sapa thông qua nguồn lưu trữ trên internet và do vậy bạn không thể nào biết được ở Sapa nó có cảm giác như thế nào, bạn chỉ lấy cảm nhận của mình thông qua môi trường internet và điều này là điều không trung thực trong kinh doanh. 
Chỉ cần nhớ được những điều nêu trên bạn có thể làm kinh doanh tiếp thị liên kết được một cách lâu dài. Bằng không bạn sẽ mất đi lòng tin của những khách hàng và kể từ đó những trang tiếp thị liên kết có tên miền như bạn đã giới thiệu bạn sẽ khó bán được một khóa học nào nữa, do khách hàng đã cảm nhận được khóa học trên tên miền đó có hiệu quả hay không.

What is Affiliate Marketing? How Do You Make Money with Affiliate Marketing?

In this business model, your goal is to refer customers/clients to another business. If they purchase their products/services, you make a commission on the sale. The way that these businesses track your sales is with something called a hoplink. When a customer clicks on this hoplink and then purchases an item, you get credited with the sale. 

What is Dropshipping (with Aliexpress)? How Do You Make Money with Dropshipping? 

Dropshipping (with Aliexpress) is when you go to Aliexpress and find low-cost items to list in your own online store (e.g. you can make a store with Shopify) with a mark-up price. You then run Facebook ads to the products in your store promoting them. When a customer buys an item in your store, you then go to Aliexpress and order the item for them. You keep the difference in profit. 

Question 1: Which Is Easiest for Beginners - Affiliate Marketing or Dropshipping? 

There is no clear winner when it comes to this question: both business models have their own advantages and disadvantages. 

With affiliate marketing, it has the advantage that your affiliate merchant partner is likely established and has built up trust online. That means that if you refer a potential customer to them, that the conversion rates will be higher because they are more likely to feel comfortable purchasing from them - unlike with dropshipping where as a fresh store, you don’t have built up credibility. 

On the other hand, with dropshipping, your store is usually in a less saturated market for Facebook ads. For big, profitable affiliate products, a lot of affiliates will be trying to run Facebook ads directly to the offers, making traffic expensive and competitive. In addition, you have larger profit margins to work with when dropshipping, which also helps make it easier to create profitable Facebook ads. This is very relevant as Facebook ads are probably the easiest source of traffic for beginners. 

Question 2: What Makes the Most Money? Affiliate Marketing or Dropshipping?

Dropshipping has the highest potential to make money. The reason for this is that when you create a store and sell products in it, you are building up a list of buyers that you know are interested in the products that you sell. So if you have a store selling products related to Astrology, then you know that people who purchase items in your store are interested in products related to Astrology - and you can send out emails to them in the future promoting similar products, and make more sales/money.

With affiliate marketing, you are helping your merchant build a list - NOT you. And they will take the buyers that you send them, and they will send them a lot of emails promoting more of their products. With affiliate marketing, you are making one-off sales. 

Question 3: Which is the Most Passive? Affiliate Marketing or Dropshipping? 

Affiliate Marketing is a more passive business model than dropshipping. The reason for that is while you can semi-automate a dropshipping store, you still need to manage and fulfill orders. When a customer comes to your store and purchases an item, you need to go to Aliexpress, order the item and then get it shipped out to your customer. This is called order fulfillment. You also need to do customer support and reply to emails and messages left by customers. You can in-time make your business a lot more passive by hiring staff to run it for you, though you will need to manage those staff members.

But with affiliate marketing, you don’t do any of this - the merchant partner does this for you. THEY send the products out to the customers, THEY fulfill the orders and THEY answer customer emails. As long as you have a traffic source setup that is sending referrals to the merchant, the business will run on autopilot. 

So which is better? The answer is neither: they both have their own pros and cons. Choose the business model that is right for you.

Making an affiliate account with Amazon is not a big thing. The real challenge is to bring trafic to your own website or channel etc. and diverting them to Amazon site. Amazon doesn't operate in Pakistan. It mean you will be promoting their products for the countries where they sell their products e.g. USA, Canada, UK, Australia, India etc. Most of these countries have English as their native or official language. My question is how many Pakistanis can write articles or reviews in English language which can impress or inspire the English speaking people and keep them landing to their website and then divert them to Amazon for making a purchase? Almost impossible.
Forget about Amazon unless you have very good command on English and you can write or speak at least equal to or better than the English speaking people. Daraz pk is good for Pakisanis for affilate marketing, where one can earn few hundred rupees per month, enough for having few cups of tea or coffee.

Ima sum up this whole video for people who don't want to waste time watching this. Don't take the "You dont need an audience" part. That is bullshit. marketing is all about an audience. Basically, start any social media page, gain an audience, then promote products, apps, anything that people will pay for to be promoted to a big audience. It is hard to grow on any social media, but that is the hard part. This isn't easy. Entrepreneurship is the hardest thing in this world. People who work a 9:00-5:00 job do mediocre work, entrepreneurs work the hardest. So if you want to start doing this, get ready to fucking grind, and not stop. That is the best part about it. Once you get to the top you will miss the grind trust me. Anyways, start to build an audience, then once you get a "loyal" audience, then you can start promoting. But go out there, grind your fucking ass off, and gain financial security. Don't stop. Make the haters come. That is the best part. Proving the people who hated on you wrong. "You gotta be possessed with the dream" "Fuck they opinions why would I listen they ain't see the vision". Ima leave it at that.

"You don't need an audience" um, thats actually exactly what you need. If you are getting 0 views for months, that means no money... social media marketing/affiliate marketing requires a big audience to make money. I run an SMA, started from 0, made nothing till I got to around 20k views, and that was around $200 a week. Once I got up to a few hundred thousand, then it boosted to $3000+ weekly. Once I hit a mil, $1000+ daily. Audience is the key to marketing. No ifs buts or anything about it. If you have no audience you aren't gonna make $$. Sure you are saying that you have to be passionate, and it took me years to get to the point I am at. If you guys want to build an audience, start off by making videos (or in my case a snapchat account) that every single teen/young adult will enjoy. If you start off the bat by promoting a link with no views, you are wasting your time. Start off with gaming or cinematics, things people will want to learn from, then they will buy your gear. For me, I started a meme page a few years ago. Who doesn't look at memes who is under the age of 25. So that was my start. Traction picked up and I grew. Once I got to a certain point, I was advertising apps and websites and companies that want traction.

Geiles Video,  Nico! Ich bin auch ein großer Affiliate Marketing Fan, bevorzuge aber YouTube im Vergleich zu Websites. Ich habe vor einigen Wochen einen neues „Nischenkanal“ erstellt, und jetzt sind schon 20,- Umsatz in der Tasche!

Kleine Frage: Muss man wirklich zu jedem einzelnen Produkt eine eigene Webseite machen? Verwirrt das den potenziellen Kunden nicht, vielleicht, wenn er erst auf meiner Seite landet und dann auf der, von dem das Produkt stammt? Bei den Seiten, die von Affiliates erstellt wurden, sieht es nach einer Imageseite aus und dabei ist man ja nicht der Eigentümer des Produkts oder der Dienstleistung. Ich persönlich würde hingehen und ein kleines Video erstellen, mit dem Inhalt, dass ich etwas cooles gefunden habe, dass den Kunden vielleicht interessieren würde und dann anhand meines Promolinks, den Kunden, auf die eigentliche Homepage schicken. Für mich wäre es verwirrend, wenn ich auf verschiedenen Seiten landen muss, um etwas zu kaufen. Dazu kommt halt, dass jedes Produkt, welches man bewirbt, eine eigene Homepage haben muss. Geht es nicht so, dass man eine Homepage mit Verlinkung zu jeweiligen Produkt verbinden kann und dafür aber mehr an Produkten auf seiner Seite bewirbt? Vielleicht kann man dadurch ja noch mehr Verkäufe erzielen, da der Kunde ja schon mal da ist und vielleicht sind ja noch andere Dinge auf der Homepage des Affiliates, die den Kunden interessieren könnten. Wäre das nicht taktisch klüger? Oder habe ich jetzt total einen Denkfehler? Als Mediengestalter weiß ich, wie wichtig Internetpräsenz ist und wie viel eine klare Struktur bewirken kann, vor allem was das Verkaufen angeht. Ich persönlich, würde mir vielleicht die eigentliche Homepage ansehen, wenn sie denn mehr oder weniger gut ist, aber wäre trotzdem irritiert, warum ich denn nun auf eine Seite komme, die ganz anders aussieht, als die Vorherige und würde Zweifel bekommen. Ich hoffe ich kann vermitteln, was ich meine xD

Sooooo tired of this crap... "Let me give you a bunch of vague / generalized info or theory", that's been rehashed to death by all these "top gurus / super affiliates".  Mainly just a 50,000 foot high level view of things, no actual details or step by step directions.  "Find a niche, make a blog, give away a free product, collect emails, then email list and make $$$$$." Great in theory yes... But this is NOT a "Step-By-Step" video.  For Dummies, YES.  If you are new to this, then of course this will sound amazing, and sucker in many people before they know exactly how much $$ and time this will take.  Will your concept work??? For some, of course it will, but for most, no it will not.  The "Dummies" as it were will spend all of their hard earned $$ on your system and course, and then realize how much time, work and effort it is and just bail out.  Of course you don't care because you've made your $$$ of them.  And then when your MLM you've been pitching shuts down or everyone leave, no worries, you have your "list".  You can just find a new MLM and push everyone.. Sorry.. "Influence them" into the next MLM... Then your fist link in the description is to your MLM...  And yeah, Health/Wealth/Relationships.. most profitable, yes.. but most saturated niches by tons of hucksters pitching their MLM.  Sorry if I sound jaded, but I'm just so tired of all the "top mlm gurus" pitching their system their lackeys and in turn putting up tons of YouTube videos pitching it to the masses.. Er Dummies...  Do some of these systems work??? yes.. some do.. But what is left out is the time and investment and amount of actual work needed.  And what is left out of most of these videos is that actual how to.. the step by step part...  Does it suck in all the wide eyed 'dummies' looking to make money online, of course it does by the 1,000s.  You and all the gurus make their money, the people that don't have the drive to put in some effort, drop out.  You then move onto the next MLM and start all over.  But hey.. if it works for you, have fun...

You are straw-manning affiliate marketing. There are ways to do it with paid traffic that allow you to make more profit than dropshipping and collect email. The way you do this is by selecting an offer that you want to promote and making content around it. Let’s say I want to promote Hostgator’s $1 month hosting discount (they pay up to $125 for each signup). What I do next is create a mini course teaching people how to set up email marketing campaigns that people need to opt in to access. In it I will teach them to use Hostgator and that by using my link they can get an exclusive $1 trial. Than I promote other software that I use in the videos too.

That's why you use a lead magnet and build your own list so you can earn from more offers from the same buyer... Also depends on the affiliate offer. Get something like a membership so you get repeat buyers and monthly recurring passive income.

Ich persönlich mache bei Radio Umfragen mit. Man bekommt pro Woche 1 oder 2 Umfragen die jeweils knappe 10 Minuten gehen und mit 2 Euro vergütet werden. Wenn man 10 Euro hat kann man sich das Geld als PayPal Zahlung, Amazon Gutschein oder direkt auf's Bankkonto überweisen lassen. Man bekommt halt irgendwelche Songs vorgespielt und muss angeben wie sehr man diese mag und dementsprechend wie gerne man sie im Radio hört/hören würde. Hab sogar letzten Monat eine 1,5 Stunden Umfrage mit direkter 20 Euro Vergütung zugeschickt bekommen. Ich mach da kein Hehl draus, reich wird man davon ganz sicher nicht. Aber für den kleinen Aufwand einen 10er mehr im Monat? Sagt man nicht nein ;) Wer das auch mal ausprobieren möchte kann sich ja hier gerne bei mir melden :)

Es funktioniert auf jeden Fall, nur gibt es leider ein großes Problem in diesem Geschäft. Den meisten die diese Art von Business betreiben geht es nur darum ihre Produkte oder Affiliate Links zu vermarkten und das Problem bei dieser Sache ist die meisten bieten dir keinen Mehrwert das bedeutet sie versprechen dir meistens etwas was nicht zu 100% der Wahrheit entspricht. Ich habe mir beispielsweise am Anfang viele Kurse etc. gekauft wo mir versprochen wurde das Ich Erfolg haben werde wenn ich diese Anleitung befolge und bla bla bla. Im Endeffekt war das verbranntes Geld ! Ich habe mir dann hauptsächlich meine Strategien durch FB und YouTube angelernt und dann klappte es auch nach langer Zeit, viel probieren und Geduld. Das wichtigste ist du musst die Produkte richtig vermarkten können sie sollten einen Mehrwert bieten am besten du informierst dich gut über die Produkte. Ich kann nur aus Erfahrung sprechen es gibt z.B. auf Digistore24 nur wenige Produkte die dich wirklich zum Erfolg bringen. Das richtige Produkt

Die richtige Zielgruppe
Preis/Leistung Mehrwert
Mindset
Geduld und Zeit….
